title: Quiz 2 - Average
instruction: Directions (46-50): Each of the following questions consist of 3 statements A,B and C. You have to determine that which of the following statement/statements are necessary to answer the questions:

quiz.text: The average weight of a group of 20 boys was calculated to be 89.4 kg and it was later discovered that one weight was misread as 78 kg instead of the correct one of 87 kg. The correct average weight is :
options: 88.95 kg
89.25 kg
89.55 kg
89.85 kg
None of these

quiz.text: A class has 20 boys and 30 girls. The average age of boys is 11 years and that of girls is 12 years. What is the average age of the whole class
options: 11.6 years
12 years
10 years
11.2 years
None of these

quiz.text: A cricketer scored some runs in his continuous 9 innings. He scored 100 runs in his 10th innings and this increased his average by 8 runs. What was the average of his runs at the end of 10th innings?
options: 20
24
28
32
None of the above

quiz.text: The average age of three boys is 15 yr. If the ratio of their ages is 3 : 5 : 7, what is the age of the oldest boy?
options: 7 yr
14 yr
20 yr
21 yr
None of these

quiz.text: Nine friends have a dinner in a hotel. Eight of them spent Rs. 12 each on their meals and the ninth spent Rs. 16 more than the average expenditure of all the nine. Find out the total money spent by them?
options: Rs. 126
Rs. 135
Rs. 111
Rs. 141
None of these

quiz.text: The average of certain first consecutive even number is 101. Find their sum?
options: 25,000
33,600
10100
24,960
None of these

quiz.text: The average of certain first consecutive natural numbers is 20.5. Find their sum.
options: 282
450
518
820
None of these

quiz.text: If the average of m numbers is n2 and that of n numbers is m2, then the average of (m + n) numbers is -
options: m/n
m+n
mn
m – n
None of these

quiz.text: An aeroplane flies along the four sides of a square field at speeds of 200, 400, 600 and 800 km/hr. The average speed of the plane in the flight around the field in km/hr is:
options: 384
400
500
284
None of these

quiz.text: The average speed of a cyclist who covers first, second and third km at 20, 16 and 12 km/hr respectively (in km/hr) is?
options: 16.24
16
15.66
15.32
None of these

quiz.text: In a class of 100 students, the mean marks obtained in a subject is 30 and in another class of 50 students the mean marks obtained in the same subject is 60. The mean marks obtained by the students of two classes taken together is :
options: 40
45
48
50
None of these

quiz.text: The mean weight of 34 students of a school is 42 kg. If the weight of the teacher be included, the mean rises by 400 g. Find the weight (in kg) of the teacher.
options: 66
56
55
57
None of these

quiz.text: The average weight of 21 boys was recorded as 64 kg. If the weight of the ‘teacher was added, the average increased by one kg. What was the teacher’s weight?
options: 86 kg
64 kg
72 kg
98 kg
None of these

quiz.text: Roshan bought 5 pants at Rs. 25 each, 10 shirts at Rs. 50 each and 15 ties at Rs. 35 each. Find the average price of all the articles.
options: Rs. 38.33
Rs. 45
Rs. 60
Rs. 45.33
None of these

quiz.text: The mean weight of 150 students in a class is 60 kg. The mean weight of boys is 70 kg and that of girls is 55 kg. What is the number of boys in the class?
options: 50
60
75
100
None of these

quiz.text: The average of the test scores of a class of ‘m’ students is 70 and that of ‘n’ students is 91. When the scores of both the classes are combined, the average is 80. What is n/m?
options: 11/10
13/10
10/13
10/11
None of these

quiz.text: The average marks of 120 students are 35. If average of passed students was 39 and failed students was 15, then  Find the number of students who have passed?
options: 80
100
120
140
None of these

quiz.text: A person covers 9 km with a speed of 3 km/h, 25 km with a speed of 5 km/h and 30 km with a speed of 10 km/h. Find out the average speed of person?
options: None of these

quiz.text: Five years ago, the average age of P and Q was 15 year. Now, average age of P, Q and R is 20 yr. What would be the age of R after 10 yr?
options: 35 yr
40 yr
30 yr
50 yr
None of these

quiz.text: The average salary of the entire staff in an office is Rs. 500 per day. The average salary of officers is Rs. 750 and that of non-officers is Rs. 250. If the number of officers is 15, then find the number of non-officers in the office?
options: 25
10
15
20
None of these

quiz.text: Three year ago, the average age of a family of five members was 27 yr. The present average age is also 27 yr after the inclusion of a child into the family. Find the age of the child?
options: 16 yr
12 yr
24 yr
20 yr
None of these

quiz.text: The average age of 5 sisters is 20 yr. If the age of the youngest sister be 4 years, what was the average age of the group of sisters at the birth of the youngest sister?
options: 25 yr
15 yr
18 yr
20 yr
None of these

quiz.text: The average weight of 4 men A, B, C and D, is 67 kg. The 5th man E is included and the average weight decreases by 2 kg. A is replaced by F. The weight of F is 4 kg more than E. Average weight decreases because of the replacement of A and now the average weight is 64 kg. Find the weight of A?
options: 78 kg
66 kg
75 kg
58 kg
None of these

quiz.text: Average of a, b and c is 11; average of c, d and e is 17; average of e and f is 22 and average of e and c is 17. Find out the average of a, b, c, d, e and f?
options: None of these

quiz.text: The average age of a man and his two twins born on the same day is 30 yr. The ratio of the ages of a father and one son is 5: 2, what is the father’s age?
options: 50 yr
30 yr
45 yr
20 yr
None of these

quiz.text: If the average of the ages of Rakesh and Mohan is 15, average of the ages of Mohan and Ramesh is 12 and the average of the ages of Rakesh and Ramesh is 13, then the age of Mohan, is?
options: 16
13
14
12
None of these

quiz.text: The average of three numbers is 28. If first number is half of the second and the 3rd number is twice the second, then the third number is?
options: 48
36
24
18
None of these

quiz.text: The average temperature from Monday to Wednesday is 37°C while the average temperature from tuesday to thursday is 34°C. The temperature of thursday is 4/5 times to that of Monday. Find the temperature of Thursday?
options: 36°C
33°C
37°C
34°C
None of these

quiz.text: The average weight of A, B and C is 84 kgs. If D joins, the average weight now is 80 kgs. If another person E who is 3 kgs heavier than D replaces A then the average weight of B, C, D and E becomes 79 kgs. What is the weight of A?
options: 70 kg
75 kg
65 kg
55 kg
None of these

quiz.text: A batsman has an average of 30 runs in his 42 innings. The difference between his maximum and minimum score is 100. If these two innings are removed his average for 40 innings comes down to 28. What is his minimum score?
options: 20
30
45
40
None of these

quiz.text: Five years ago the average age of husband and wife was 23 years. Today the average age of husband, wife and child is 20 yrs. How old is child?
options: 3 yrs
4 yrs
12 yrs
2 yrs
None of these

quiz.text: The average age of a husband and wife, who were married 7 years ago, was 25 years at the time of their marriage, Now, the average age of the family, including husband, wife and a child, born during the interval, is 22 years. What is the present age of the child?
options: 4 yrs.
2 yrs.
3 yrs.
5 yrs.
None of these

quiz.text: The average age of mother, father and son was 42 yrs at the time of the marriage of the son. After one year an infant was born in the family and after 6 yrs of marriage the average age of the family is 36 years. What was the age of the bride at the time of marriage.
options: 25 yrs.
23 yrs.
22 yrs.
24 yrs.
None of these

quiz.text: There were 35 students in a hostel. If the number of students increases by 7, the expenses of the mess increase by Rs. 42 per day while the average expenditure per head decreases by Rs. 1.  Find the original expenditure of the mess.
options: Rs. 420
Rs. 520
Rs. 450
Rs. 550
None of these

quiz.text: Ashish has earned an average of 4200 dollars for the first eleven months of the year. If he justifies his staying on in the US on the basis of his ability to earn at least 5000 dollars per month for the entire year, how much should he earn (in dollars) in the last month to achieve his required average for the whole year?
options: 14,600
5,800
12,800
13800
None of these

quiz.text: If in Textile department, the present age of female employee is 70% of the age of Male employee 4 years hence and difference between the present age of the female employee and Transgender employee is one fourth of the present age of female employee. What is the average age of all the employees in textile department if Transgender employee is older person in that department?
options: 27 years
37 years
30 years
33 years
31 years

quiz.text: If the difference between the ages of the Male employee and Transgender employee in the Education Department was 12 years and that ratio is 3:4 and the average age of the same department after 5 years is 42 years, then find the present age of the female employee.
options: 16 years
27 years
21 years
32 years
35 years

quiz.text: If average age of all the employees in Finance department in 2007 was 39 (1/3) then what will be the ratio of their ages in 2010?
options: 41:37:40
40:17:50
50:30:41
55:37:41
50:37:40

quiz.text: The age of female employee in Defence department is the average age of male employee and Transgender employee of that department. Then the age of female employee is what percent of total age of all employees in the same department.
options: 35(1/3)%
31(1/3)%
33(1/3)%
41(1/3)%
37(1/3)%

quiz.text: Age of Transgender employee in commerce department is 85% of the present age of Transgender employee of the Finance department and the age of female employee in commerce department after 32 years is 2 times the present age of the Transgender employee in commerce department. Find what percent the present age of female employee is of the average age of the all employees in the same department after 4 years.
options: 72.62%
81.81%
73.88%
92.53%
98.35%

quiz.text: What is the ratio of number of female employee from Technical department to number of employees under age of 40 from HR department?
options: 5:3
3:5
2:3
1:2
1:3

quiz.text: If the number of females in marketing department is 30, then find the number of employees whose age is more than 40 years in same department.
options: 129
195
168
157
182

quiz.text: What is the difference between Total employees in Coordination department and female employees in HR department if 10% of total employees are in Marketing department?
options: 480
517
289
172
162

quiz.text: If in coordination department, there are no employees under 40 years, then by what percent number of employee under the age of 40 in Administration are more than the total number of employees in marketing department if 10% of total employees are in the Marketing department?
options: 168%
112%
125%
179%
105%

quiz.text: If in Administration department 35% females are under the age of 40, then what is the ratio of number of females who are above 40 to the number of males who are under the age of 40 in the same department (Let in coordination department, there are no employees under 40 years)?
options: 112:119
118:113
117:219
135:116
117:183

quiz.text:
Find the average of present ages of P, Q and R.

Statement A: The average age of P, Q and R 15 years ago was 33years.

Statement B: The present ages of P, Q and R are in the ratio of 8 : 9 : 12.

Statement C: The average age of P, Q and R 15 years hence is 63years
options: A and B are sufficient
B and C are sufficient
Either A or C is sufficient
Statement B and either statement A or statement C are sufficient
All together are necessary

quiz.text:
Kumud’s mark in Geography are 20 more than the average marks obtained by him in English, History, Geography and Mathematics. What is the difference between the marks obtained by him in History and Mathematics? To answer the above question, which of the following information given in the statements I and II is/are sufficient?

Statement I. Total marks obtained by him in Geography and History is 160

Statement II. The total marks obtained by him in History Geography and Mathematics is 210.
options: Both I and II together are not sufficient
Both I and II together are needed.
Only I alone is sufficient.
Only II alone is sufficient.
Either I or II alone is sufficient.

quiz.text:
Whose body weight is second highest among the five boys Arun, Vinay, Suraj, Raju and Pratap?

Statement I. Average weight of Arun, Suraj and Vinay is 68 kg and average weight of Raju and Pratap is 72 kg. Also, Suraj is 78 kg. Raju is 68 kg and Vinay is 46 kg.

Statement II. Average weight of Arun, Suraj, Vinay and Raju is 68 kg and also Suraj is 78 kg. Raju is 68 kg and Vinay is 46 kg. All of them have different weights.
options: Both I and II together are not sufficient
Both I and II together are needed.
Only I alone is sufficient.
Only II alone is sufficient.
Either I or II alone is sufficient

quiz.text:
What will be the average of three numbers?

Statement I. The largest no. is greater than the smallest by 20.

Statement II. The sum of the largest and smallest nos. is equal to twice the middle one.

Statement III. The difference of the first two numbers is 10.
options: Only A and C together
Only B and C together
Any two of them
Question can't be answered even after using all the information
All statements are required

quiz.text:
How many marks did Arif obtain in Physics?

Statement A. The average marks obtained by Arif in History, English and Physics is 70.

Statement B. The difference between the marks obtained by Arif in English and that in History is 10.

Statement C. The total marks obtained by Arif in Biology and Physics is 120.
options: None
Only C
Either B or C
Any of them
Question can’t be answered even after using all the information
